intro: Retzia roelloides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Retzia roelloides is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
